alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 11:53PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Montgomery and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - The heaviest rainfall is currently over Badin and Eldorado, with additional rainfall still upstream. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Badin Lake, Norwood, Badin, Mount Gilead, Morrow Mountain State Park, Lake Tillery, Eldorado, Uwharrie Haven, Whip-O-Will Campground, Fish Tales Marina and Pinehaven Marina. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Rural roads south of Mt Gilead near the PeeDee River and Little Rivers, Town Creek between Main St and Snuggs Rd, Quemby Mall & Delco Plaza, Mountain Creek at Mountain Creek Rd, Melchor Branch at Ridge St. and Rocky River at Hwy 52.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
